sentences.english: And fire raised man above all animals .

sentences.chinese: 褪盡紅塵萬物，自混沌中走來。

sentences.english: All things change, and we change with them.
sentences.chinese: 萬物皆變，吾人亦當以變應之。

sentences.english: Did God create everything that exists?
sentences.chinese: 萬事萬物都是上帝創造的嗎？

sentences.english: Through the sadness of all things I hear the crooning of the Eternal Mother.
sentences.chinese: 在萬物的哀愁裏，我聽到了“永恆母親”的柔聲細語。

sentences.english: Nuwa not only to the day of salvation, but also in creation, work miracles.
sentences.chinese: 女媧不但補天救世，還創造萬物，神通廣大。

sentences.english: Everything from the Tao to grow, and then return to the road.
sentences.chinese: 萬物由道而生，循着道成長，而後又迴歸於道。

sentences.english: My teacher told me that the great and the selfless Tao upholds all things.
sentences.chinese: 我的老師告訴我，道是偉大的，祂覆載萬物而無私。

sentences.english: Animism is common among primitive peoples.
sentences.chinese: 萬物有靈論在原始人中很普遍。

sentences.english: Omnia sol temperat The sun warms everything.
Vow to be the earth that nurtures plants and cradles sentient beings.
sentences.chinese: 發願作一方大地，普載衆生，生長萬物。

sentences.english: As Frost's Descent comes, the world is filled with the atmosphere of late autumn.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着霜降的到臨，萬物充滿了晚秋的氣息。

sentences.english: In ancient times, all things upon Earth smelled sweet like flowers.
sentences.chinese: 在遠古時代，地球上的萬物都聞起來就象花朵一樣。

sentences.english: The heart is deceitful above all things and beyond cure. Who can understand it?
sentences.chinese: 人心比萬物都詭詐，壞到極處，誰能識透呢。

sentences.english: The spring snow melt, all things recovery, 10000 Purple Yan-hong, to give hope.
sentences.chinese: 春天冰雪融化，萬物復甦，萬紫嫣紅，給人們希望。

sentences.english: Everything is in the form of atoms, and every particle contains the qudrat, the power of Allah.
sentences.chinese: 在一粒原子中包含了萬物，這是真主的能力。

definition: the four seasons, namely: spring 春, summer 夏, autumn 秋 and winter 冬
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
to work/to operate/to revolve/to turn around
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
